page.title: 10Agriculture (Cattle Raising)
page.content: In this block all the cattle belong to the estate to the North of the block. All are for beef, the most common breed being Cross_Hereford. There are no dairy cows. At the time of writing (June 1985) there are 102 cows with calves at foot grazing in the block. They are fed on silage in winter with a supplementary feed of minerals and cereals. Approx. 100 calves aged 14 months are sold each year, the average price for each calf in 1984 about Â£280. The calves are taken to markets in Dalmally and Stirling. About 12 heifer calves are retained each year.
